newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish hearing aid firm develops long-life battery.
newsitem.headline: Danish hearing aid firm develops long-life battery.

text.p: Danish hearing aid firm William Demant and Danish Technical University (DTU) researchers have developed a chip capable of prolonging the battery life of hearing aids five times, ComputerWorld magazine reported on Friday.
"DTU and Demant have developed a chip with 90,000 transistors with one of the biggest asynchronous circuits known capable of quintupling the life of batteries in hearing aids," the magazine wrote.
"The project will reduce the power consumption in future generations of our digital hearing aids," an executive of Demant, formerly Oticon, said.
